page.title: 15Wildlife
page.content: On the moors there is a lot of wildlife including otters. A dog otter needs about twelve miles for his territory. They like to eat eels and small fish. They prefer to live away from people. Some farmers would like to change the use they make of the land and grow crops on some of the fields which are now used for grazing. If they did this there might not be anywhere suitable for otters to live. The County Council is trying to avoid this happening. They intend to declare parts of the Somerset Levels sites of scientific interest. This would mean that there would have to be discussions between all those interested before any changes were allowed.
